newsitem.title: USA: National Semi, Cyrix plan sub-$500 PC by early '98.
newsitem.headline: National Semi, Cyrix plan sub-$500 PC by early '98.

text.p: National Semiconductor Corp. and Cyrix Corp said their decision to merge operations would allow them to offer chips for sub-$500 personal computers by early 1998.

"The companies are already working together on an optimized platform and I think we ought to be able to offer a sub-$500 net PC to the world by early 1998," said Steve Tobak, Cyrix's vice-president for marketing.
He said major PC manufacturers were already showing "very very strong interest in offering low cost systems" like those the combined company plans to focus on.
National Semiconductor earlier said it agreed to buy Cyrix in a stock deal valued at $550 million.
"We are focused on growth of the market and the way to do that is by taking today's perfromance and bringing it to new price points that people can afford," Tobak said.
"The goal is to take all of the capability currently available and dominate the entry-level PC computer market," he said.
